FIELD.NAME: course
FIELD.COMMENT: Course coursework activity belongs to

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: name field for moodle instances

FIELD.NAME: intro
FIELD.COMMENT: General introduction of the coursework activity

FIELD.NAME: introformat
FIELD.COMMENT: Format of the intro field (MOODLE, HTML, MARKDOWN...)

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the maximum grade possible for this coursework

FIELD.NAME: deadline
FIELD.COMMENT: unix timestamp for when the coursework should be submitted

FIELD.NAME: srsinclude
FIELD.COMMENT: flag: do we want to prevent markers from knowing the students' name

FIELD.NAME: numberofmarkers
FIELD.COMMENT: How many feedback grades should each submission have before it can be published?

FIELD.NAME: blindmarking
FIELD.COMMENT: flag: do we want to prevent markers from knowing the students' name

FIELD.NAME: generalfeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: unix timestamp for when the general assignment feedback should be available

FIELD.NAME: individualfeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: unix timestamp for when the general assignment feedback should be available

FIELD.NAME: courseworktype
FIELD.COMMENT: Tells us if this is undergraduate or postgraduate or (in future) something else.

FIELD.NAME: assessorallocationstrategy
FIELD.COMMENT: classname of the allocation strategy that will be used to pair students and teachers automatically.

FIELD.NAME: moderationenabled
FIELD.COMMENT: Is this coursework being moderated?

FIELD.NAME: allocationenabled
FIELD.COMMENT: Do we want to have pairings made between teachers and students, either manually or automatically, or shall we just leave it as a free-for-all?

FIELD.NAME: moderatorallocationstrategy
FIELD.COMMENT: Strategy for matching moderators to students in the moderation set. Matches the end of a coursework_allocation_strategy_xxx class

FIELD.NAME: viewothersfeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: If set to true, markers will be able to view the feedback of other markers once they have completed their own. This runs counter to the principles of blind marking (might cause unfair bias), but is useful for some situations.

FIELD.NAME: autoreleasefeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: If true, feedback (but not grades) will be released automatically to the student when the deadline passes.

FIELD.NAME: retrospectivemoderation
FIELD.COMMENT: This flag, which in future will be replaced bu fully configurable marking stages, tells us to ignore the marks that the moderator gives so that they are just indicative of the quality of the first marker. If they are very different, the coursework can be switched to allow a full remark, where the moderator marks become marker2 marks.

FIELD.NAME: studentviewcomponentfeedbacks
FIELD.COMMENT: If true, the students can see feedbacks from the component marks given by teachers before the final grade is agreed. If false, they only see the final feedback. Only relevant to multiple marked courseworks.

FIELD.NAME: studentviewmoderatorfeedbacks
FIELD.COMMENT: Can students view feedback from moderators?

FIELD.NAME: strictanonymity
FIELD.COMMENT: If we allow publishing when blind marking is enabled and some students have not submitted, or have an extension, then it may be possible for markers to deduce the student's identity. If this setting is off, such publishing is allowed.

FIELD.NAME: studentviewfinalfeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: Can the student view the comments on the final agreed feedback

FIELD.NAME: studentviewcomponentgrades
FIELD.COMMENT: Can the student view the component grades in multiple graded courseworks

FIELD.NAME: studentviewfinalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: Can the student view the final agreed grade in multi marker courseworks

FIELD.NAME: studentviewmoderatorgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: Can the student view the moderator grades

FIELD.NAME: strictanonymitymoderator
FIELD.COMMENT: Do we enforce the prevention of publishing when moderation is in use and some work has not been moderated?

FIELD.NAME: allowlatesubmissions
FIELD.COMMENT: If true, students will be able to submit after the deadline even if they don't have a submission

TABLE.NAME: coursework_feedbacks
TABLE.COMMENT: Each row represents the feedback given for one submission by one teacher. This can include the aggregated/consolidated feedback given by the publisher

FIELD.NAME: cappedgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: If late, the actual grade will be capped at a maximum that is configurable in various ways.Normally, this will be the same as grade.

FIELD.NAME: feedbackcomment
FIELD.COMMENT: The textual feedback given by this marker. For aggregated comments (final), it will be only what is in addition to the comments of the component markers.

FIELD.NAME: timepublished
FIELD.COMMENT: When did this grade get put into the gradebook? May not apply to component feedbacks, just final ones.

FIELD.NAME: lasteditedbyuser
FIELD.COMMENT: In case a manager edits a feedback, we want to be able to keep track of this.

FIELD.NAME: isfinalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: Flag to show whether this record is the result of an agreement between all the markers in multiple marked courseworks.

FIELD.NAME: ismoderation
FIELD.COMMENT: Flag to show whether this is a feedback made by a moderator or not.

FIELD.NAME: markernumber
FIELD.COMMENT: When we have multiple markers, this is useful for making reports where we show marker1, marker2, etc. Without it, the SQL is awkward for LEFT JOIN

KEY.NAME: submissionid-id
KEY.COMMENT: Links the feedback and submissions tables

TABLE.NAME: coursework_submissions
TABLE.COMMENT: Student submissions for the easssessment module. Files are linked via a separate table.

FIELD.NAME: finalised
FIELD.COMMENT: If true, then the student can no longer add files.

FIELD.NAME: manualsrscode
FIELD.COMMENT: Temporary solution for KCL requirement for a student to be able to manually enter their SRS number.

FIELD.NAME: createdby
FIELD.COMMENT: User id of creator

FIELD.NAME: lastupdatedby
FIELD.COMMENT: User id of last person to update this submission.

FIELD.NAME: allocatableid
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user or group

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group

FIELD.NAME: allocatabletype
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of the user or group

KEY.NAME: courseworkid-id
KEY.COMMENT: links the coursework and submission tables

FIELD.NAME: remindernumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Two reminders get sent at the moment

TABLE.NAME: coursework_allocation_pairs
TABLE.COMMENT: Holds teacher-student pairings to keep track of who has been allocated to mark what.

FIELD.NAME: manual
FIELD.COMMENT: If set to 1, this is an allocation expressly made by an admin, so we might want the auto-allocations to work around it.

FIELD.NAME: moderator
FIELD.COMMENT: Is this amoderator allocation?

FIELD.NAME: timelocked
FIELD.COMMENT: When someone starts to grade a piece of work, we want to lock their allocation so that automatic re-allocations will not remove it. This field holds a timestamp, which will prevent re-allocation if it's recent enough.

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group

TABLE.NAME: coursework_mod_set_rules
TABLE.COMMENT: Moderation sets for each coursework need to include certain groups e.g. all students with grades less than 40%. This allows us to keep track of which rules have been added. The order matters as some will be top-up rules.

FIELD.NAME: courseworkid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of the coursework record this realtes to

FIELD.NAME: rulename
FIELD.COMMENT: This forms part of the name of the class which controls this rule

FIELD.NAME: ruleorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Some rules need to come after others. This allows them to be given weights so that they will be processed in this sequence.

FIELD.NAME: upperlimit
FIELD.COMMENT: We include all students below this limit

FIELD.NAME: lowerlimit
FIELD.COMMENT: We include all students above this boundary

FIELD.NAME: minimum
FIELD.COMMENT: Minimum number of items to include. Used if we have a range and need to make sure we have a certain number.

TABLE.NAME: coursework_allocation_config
TABLE.COMMENT: Holds settings that determine (for some allocation strategies) limits to the allocations each teacher will be allocated e.g. 10 percent.

FIELD.NAME: courseworkid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID from coursework table

FIELD.NAME: allocationstrategy
FIELD.COMMENT: Name of the allocation strategy class when we remove the 'coursework_allocation_strategy_' prefix

FIELD.NAME: assessorid
FIELD.COMMENT: The teacher who will be limited by this setting

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: Varies according to the strategy

FIELD.NAME: purpose
FIELD.COMMENT: Currently either for assessor or moderator allocation, but maybe more in future

TABLE.NAME: coursework_mod_set_members
TABLE.COMMENT: Tracks the students who are in the moderation set for a particular coursework

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group

TABLE.NAME: coursework_extensions
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores new extensions that can be given to a student or group beyond the standard deadline.

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group

TABLE.NAME: coursework_sample_set_rules
TABLE.COMMENT: Automatic sample sets for each coursework stage. This allows us to keep track of which rules have been added. The order matters as some will be top-up rules.

TABLE.NAME: coursework_sample_set_mbrs
TABLE.COMMENT: Tracks the students who are in the sample set for a particular coursework

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group

TABLE.NAME: coursework_person_deadlines
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores personal deadlines that can be given to a student or group.

FIELD.NAME: allocatableuser
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the user

FIELD.NAME: allocatablegroup
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the group
